text: Service level agreement
Interpretation
The following definitions and rules of interpretation apply in this schedule.

runs.text: The following definitions and rules of interpretation apply in this schedule.

text: Definitions:
Commercially Reasonable Efforts: the same degree of priority and diligence with which the Supplier meets the support needs of its other similar customers.

runs.text: : the same degree of priority and diligence with which the Supplier meets the support needs of its other similar customers.

text: Contact List: a current list of Supplier contacts and telephone numbers to enable the Customer to escalate its Support Requests, including:

runs.text: : a current list of Supplier contacts and telephone numbers to enable the Customer to escalate its Support Requests, including:

text: the first person to contact; and

runs.text: the first person to contact; and

text: the persons in successively more qualified or experienced positions to provide the support sought.

runs.text: the persons in successively more qualified or experienced positions to provide the support sought.

text: Customer Cause: any of the following causes:
any improper use, misuse or unauthorised alteration of the Software by the Customer;

runs.text: any improper use, misuse or unauthorised alteration of the Software by the

text: any use of the Software by the Customer in a manner inconsistent with the then-current Documents;

text: the use by the Customer of any hardware or software not provided by the Supplier [or approved by the Supplier in the Specification for use by the Customer in connection with the Software]; or

runs.text: the use by the Customer of any hardware or software not provided by the Supplier [or approved by the Supplier in the Specification for use by the Customer in connection with the Software]; or

text: the use of a non-current version or release of the Software.

runs.text: the use of a non-current version or release of the Software.

text: Fault: any Operational Fault [or Vulnerability].

Good Industry Practice: the exercise of that degree of skill, care, prudence, efficiency, foresight and timeliness as would be expected from a [leading] company within the relevant industry or business sector.

runs.text: : the exercise of that degree of skill, care, prudence, efficiency, foresight and timeliness as would be expected from a [leading] company within the relevant industry or business sector.

text: Help Desk Support: support provided by help desk technicians sufficiently qualified and experienced to identify and resolve most support issues relating to the Software.

runs.text: : support provided by help desk technicians sufficiently qualified and experienced to identify and resolve most support issues relating to the Software.

text: Higher-level Support: higher-level support provided by an individual on the Contact List.

runs.text: : higher-level support provided by an individual on the Contact List.

text: [Known Vulnerabilities: any Vulnerability that has either:
been assigned a Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) number;

runs.text: been assigned a Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE)

text: been disclosed on the National Vulnerability Database available at the website operated by the US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) from to time to time; or

text: Latent Vulnerabilities: any instances of typical classes of Vulnerability. For example, buffer overflows, cross-site scripting (XSS) and Structure Query Language (SQL) injection.

text: Main Agreement: the agreement to which this schedule relates.

runs.text: : the agreement to which this schedule relates.

text: Mitigate: the taking of such reasonable steps that would be taken by a prudent supplier in accordance with Good Industry Practice to mitigate against the Vulnerability in question, which may include patching or coding changes, and the terms Mitigated and Mitigation shall be construed accordingly.

text: Operational Fault: failure of the Software to operate in all material respects in accordance with the Specification and Documents, including any operational failure or error referred to in the Service Level Table.

runs.text: failure of the Software to operate in all material respects in accordance with the Specification and Documents, including any operational failure or error referred to in the Service Level Table.

text: Out-of-scope Services: either of the following services:

any services provided by the Supplier in connection with any apparent problem regarding the Software reasonably determined by the Supplier not to have been caused by a Fault, but rather by a Customer Cause or a cause outside the Supplier's control (including any investigational work resulting in such a determination); or

runs.text: any services provided by the Supplier in connection with any apparent problem regarding the Software reasonably determined by the Supplier not to have been caused by a Fault, but rather by a Customer Cause or a cause outside the Supplier's control (including any investigational work resulting in such a determination); or

text: any Higher-level Support provided in the circumstances specified in paragraph 2.3.

correction of an Operational Fault or;

text: Support Period: the Term and, if requested by the Customer, any period during which the Customer transfers the Services to an alternate service provider.

text: Any Higher-level Support requested by the Customer to be provided by an individual whose qualification or experience is greater than that reasonably necessary to resolve the relevant Support Request shall be deemed an Out-of-scope Service, provided that an appropriately qualified or experienced individual was available at the time when the Higher-level Support was sought.

the relevant Support Request shall be deemed an Out-of-scope Service, provided that an appropriately qualified or experienced individual was available at the time when the Higher-level Support was sought.

text: The Supplier may reasonably determine that any services are Out-of-scope Services. If the Supplier makes any such determination, it shall promptly notify the Customer of that determination.

runs.text: The Supplier may reasonably determine that any services are Out-of-scope Services. If the Supplier makes any such determination, it shall promptly notify the Customer of that determination.

text: Fees
The provision of Support Services on a remote, off-site basis (such as over the telephone or by e-mail) within the Support Period shall be included in the Support Fees.

runs.text: The provision of Support Services on a remote, off-site basis (such as over the telephone or by e-mail) within the Support Period shall be included in the Support Fees.

text: The provision of Support Services outside the Support Period or at the Customer Site or the provision of Out-of-scope Services shall be charged for at the applicable time and materials rates set out in [DESCRIPTION OF RELEVANT DOCUMENT SETTING OUT RATES].

runs.text: The provision of Support Services outside the Support Period or at the Customer Site or the provision of Out-of-scope Services shall be charged for at the applicable time and materials rates set out in [DESCRIPTION OF RELEVANT DOCUMENT SETTING OUT RATES].

text: Submitting Support Requests and access
The Customer may request Support Services by way of a Support Request.

runs.text: The Customer may request Support Services by way of a Support Request.

text: Each Support Request shall include a description of the Operational Fault [or Vulnerability] and, where relevant, the start time of the incident.

runs.text: Each Support Request shall include a description of the Operational Fault [or Vulnerability] and, where relevant, the start time of the incident.

text: such output and other data, documents, information, assistance and (subject to compliance with all Customer's security and encryption requirements notified to the Supplier in writing) remote access to the Customer System, as are reasonably necessary to assist the Supplier to reproduce operating conditions similar to those present when the Customer detected the relevant Operational Fault and to respond to the relevant Support Request.

text: Save for where the Supplier reasonably determines that it requires access to the Customer Site to provide the relevant Support Service, all Support Services shall be provided on an off-site basis (such as over the telephone or by e-mail) from the Supplier's office.

Definition

text: [Service Level response and response time for Vulnerabilities

runs.text: [Service Level response and response time for Vulnerabilities

text:
Business Critical Failures: An error in, or failure of, the Software that:
a) materially impacts the operations [or security] of the Customer's business or marketability [or security] of its service or product;
b)prevents necessary work from being done; or 
c)disables major functions of the Software from being performed.

runs.text: An error in, or failure of, the Software that:
a) materially impacts the operations [or security] of the Customer's business or marketability [or security] of its service or
prevents necessary work from being done; or
disables major functions of the Software from being performed.

text:
Level 1 Response:
Acknowledgment of receipt of a Support Request within [NUMBER] minutes.
Level 2 Response:
The Supplier shall:
a)restore the Software to a state that allows the Customer to continue to use all functions of the Software in all material respects within [NUMBER] hours after the Level 1 Response time has elapsed; and
b)exercise Commercially Reasonable Efforts until full restoration of function is provided.
Level 3 Response:
The Supplier shall work on the problem continuously and implement a Solution within [NUMBER] hours of receipt of the Support Request.
If the Supplier delivers a Solution by way of a workaround reasonably acceptable to the Customer, the severity level assessment shall reduce to a severity level 2 or lower.

text:

Where reported by the Customer:

text:
System Defect with Workaround: 
a)a Business Critical Failure in the Software for which a work- around above has been deployed; or 
b)an error or failure in the Software (other than a Business Critical Failure) that affects the operations [or security] of the Customer's business or marketability [or security] of its service or product.

text:
Level 1 Response:
Acknowledgment of receipt of a Support Request within [NUMBER] hours.
Level 2 Response:
The Supplier shall, within [NUMBER] Business Days after the Level 1 Response time has elapsed, provide:
a)an emergency software fix or workaround; or
b) temporary release or update release,
which allows the Customer to continue to use all functions of the Software in all material respects.
Level 3 Response:
The Supplier shall provide a permanent Fault correction as soon as practicable and no later than [NUMBER] Business Days after the Suppliers receipt of the Support Request.

text: Service Credits
